Articles.Content:
Howdy!

I have some friends playing this game  and its sound right up my alley!  Unfortunately i seem to have stumbled upon some bugs very early on in learning this game. 

Please be gentle, its my first time!

Thanks!
Frank

 

Info:

 

KSP version: 
Version 1.12.2 (currently latest in Steam)


Explanation: 
When attempting to do the Intermediate Construction within the Training I found two issues, one of which stops you from completing the Training.
Issue one:  The "Hopper" is missing from the Open menu.  We can get around this by following the instructions in the same step though (building the craft manually)
Issue two:  After placing the x5 fuel tanks we are asked to place the LV-T45 "Swivel" Engine, but unfortunately this is missing from the menu.   This makes the Training unusable from this step on wards.

Screenshot:
Issue one: (this shows one menu, but the "Hopper" isn't found in any.


Issue two:


Relevant .craft file or save file: 
None

Output Log: 
None

System Specifications: 
Windows 10 Home, 64bit, 10.019043 Build 19043. 
Game downloaded via Steam

Clean Install: 
yep

 

 

Edited August 23, 2021 by frankyface

The missing Swivel is a known issue- the Swivel engine got a new model in 1.12.2, but this is a new part and the old one got hidden in the tech tree as for other older models; the tutorials didn’t get updated though so are still looking for the old engine that isn’t there. You can still find the Swivel in the tutorial though, click the arrows in the top left of the screen then the tabs to search by size (1.25m) or manufacturer (Jeb’s Junkyard).

Ah!  i shall give this a go tonight!

Thanks for the reply!

I had the same question as Frank - and the search by manufacturer worked.

Thanks jimmymcgoochie!

Ok, so next problem - every time I try the 'Go For Orbit' training the spacecraft gets off course and Werner stops the lesson. This even happens with SAS set to Target.

Thoughts?

Cheers,

Stenry...

hahaaaa, I was stuck in the same part @Stenry !

it was about a 50% success rate when using autopilot, and on top of that was the different stages not departing my ship cleanly when firing. 
I got there in the end, but there was no secret sauce apart from retrying a few times

 

Edited August 24, 2021 by frankyface
went from 'attempting mission' to 'succeeding mission'
